intro: Anisomeles carpentarica, commonly known as the Carpentarian mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus and other host trees. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Anisomeles carpentarica plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by influencing host tree growth and providing food for native wildlife.
